content.detailedDescription: I was standing outside the front of my home speaking to my neighbor.  i suddenly caught a glimpse of something bright overhead, and to the left of where i was standing.  i immediately looked up and saw a round very bright blue ball of pulsing light.  it was travelling from the south to the north.  there was no sound.  it was approximately 500 to 1000 feet in the air.  as it was passing over the top of my house, i ran forward to try and follow it.  asking my neighbor "did you see that", "can you see it."  it disappeared, or i just couldn't see any sign of it.  it did not have a tail or after glow coma, etc.  it did not change direction or appearance.  i have no idea what it was.
content.summary: Bright pulsing blue ball, passing overhead.

content.detailedDescription: While having a family campfire and sky watching, noticed to the north-west of my location a very bright light that dimmed after around 3 seconds, then a second bright light,a distance away from the first brightened for around 3 second and then dimmed. the lights were much brighter than plane landing lights and much higher altitude. it appeared the lights were moving away so i thought nothing more about it. about 3 minutes later, i looked directly overhead, and saw a very bright single white light, about as big as a dime at arm length. the light dimmed and then i noticed two lights following each other about two inches apart, at arm length. the lights were on the same course from the initial sighting moving south east, slightly faster and about the same brightness as a satellite and at a high altitude. my 23 year old daughter, whom is in pharmacy college, also witnessed the two lights overhead. she claimed to have witnessed the lights start to rotate around each other, i did not witness this. they continued toward the south-east into high cloud cover.
content.summary: Two star like lights moving in formation.

content.detailedDescription: Para infomarles que este dia y hora, estabe en la casa de mi hijo viendon una pelicula llamada pirates of the caribbean segunda parte. hubo una esena bien ineresante donde los protagonistas estaban peleando con espada en una isla de arrenas blanca no se donde era el sitio. solo que nos percatamos de una esfera que pasa rapido por el cielo y era plateada. ya que usamos el zoom y lento del dvd. si ustedes quieren y tienen la pelicula analisenla y confirme lo escrito.
content.summary: Como una bolita plateada.

content.detailedDescription:
1. where were you and what were you doing at the time?
this was after dinner i went outside to relax and look at the sky.
2. what made you first notice the object?
i seen a black object, like a circle fly slowly.
3. what did you think the object was when you first noticed it?
i had no idea, tas very small, so i didn't think plane. probably wasn't, unless a private jet which is black or brown, or a weather balloon.
4. describe the object and its actions and motions.
it was flying slowly east for 3 minutes, then turned north.
5. describe your feelings, reactions and actions, during and after sighting the object.
i was elated. not my first sighting, sure as hell wasn't no plane i ever seen.
6. how did you lose sight of the object?
it turned north and either dissapeared into the clouds or vanished. i honestly couldn't make out what the object was, but it had a general shape of a circle.
content.summary: Was in my yard looking in the sky and saw something like a black circle or square.

content.detailedDescription: Boom that shook the house two striks on 24 mile rd west of fairchild
content.summary: Boom that shook the house two striks.

content.detailedDescription: We were sitting on our back deck having a bbq, i was watching the storm clouds move in, saw a long semi circle of black dots flying from the sw to the ne at a high rate of speed. i would estimate the objects flew about 5 miles in about 20-30 seconds then we lost the in the clouds. one of the guys thought they might have been ducks, i dont think so, ducks don't fly high enough to go through clouds let alone storm clouds, and i did not see any wings, when ducks fly you can clearly see their wings. i do a lot of fishing i am very familiar with the local wildlife, i have never seen birds fly that high, was almost a perfect semi circle, and flying way too fast
content.summary: 30-50 black dots high in the sky flew through storm clouds at a high rate of speed.

content.detailedDescription:
my boyfriend and i went to visit my parents. shortly after we arrived there was a storm that knocked out the power. my boyfriend decided to go outside and stare at the sky (i should note, he has done that every previous visit)
 after a while he was saying he saw something, and i needed to see it. me, being the skeptic i am ( and always identifying his "ufos" to just be airplanes, stars, or satellites) completely ignored him for about twenty minutes. 
 finally (and only to appease him)i went outside i looked at what he was talking about. i saw what at first looked like a plane, but the lights were flashing to quickly. and i couldn't see the distinct red light flashing. then i realized it was way to low to be a plane. the object began moving vertically and back and forth.
 i watched the yellow and white lights for about a long time before i realized i needed a picture of this- it was just too weird the flashing and way it was moving. i took about three or four and review them, and i thought them to be garbage. 
 we discussed all the possibles of what we just could have seen in the sky. there was no conclusion. the next morning we told my parents, and they seemed to get a kick out of it, so we didn't say anything to anyone else.

the real story here is when i came home to nc, and was looking back over the other pictures i started deleting the ones of the lights on the horizon and i saw one and thought, maybe if i zoom times 8x i'll see, just something... and what i saw literally shocked me. 
all we saw were lights. but the picture clearly shows a blue/gray colored, emerald shaped object with a reddish bluish field surrounding it(?) it is a remarkable picture.
content.summary: Flashing lights slowly moving in every direction, disappearing and re-apearing before our eyes.

content.detailedDescription: After parking my vehicle in the driveway at about 10:15 p.M 06-24-09 i looked up to the east sky and noticed an amber colored sphere flying west. as it became closer i noticed it didn't make any sound. it made some sort of u-turn in the sky and then flew eastward. unlike the lifeflight helicopter at bryan west hospital it made no sound nor did it have any blinking lights. it was solid in amber light color and was very bright.When it ducked into the clouds i could still partially see the bright object for a minute longer before it was absolutely no longer visible. upon seeing the object i opened the door to the house and yelled to my wife that there was a ufo. we have seen another ufo in lincoln about three years ago and did not report it then. this time i really didn't have enough time to get the camera focused on it. i tried
content.summary: From 13th street looking up to the east an amber colored orb flew west silently and made a u-turn to head back east before dissappearing into the clouds.

content.detailedDescription: I noticed a darker than cloud object making erratic movements in the low cloud cover.. it was moving super fast, aproximately 2 miles from my position looking due west torward downtown minneapolis from n. 169.  the object did 3 salom turns and headed north.  the turns were so quick. and it sped off out of site to the north within 10 seconds.. i noticed this as i was walking through a hallway to the lunch room.  the movement caught my eye, made sure it was not a reflection. at first i thought it could have been a balloon blowing in the wind, however it did not appear to be, due to it seemed to hold a constant elevation.
content.summary: Dark blurred image in low cloud cover.

content.detailedDescription:
I saw what i thought to be an aircraft, because of the intensity of the light - but the light was red.  this is not the light of an aircraft i know of - nothing coming out of dfw.  we (my entire family) watched it as it came toward our home - it was dark outside - and it came rather quickly, faster than a normal/passenger aircraft.  when it reached overhead, it disappeared.  it was quiet, and the lights were out - this is not normal aircraft activity.  a few seconds later, my wife and children saw it again to our north, but just briefly, and heading away.

it was bright, silent, and it disappeared from our view overhead and then again to my family in a matter of seconds several miles north of us.  all of this happened in approximately 30 seconds.

all i can think is that it was something burning up int he atmosphere - but, it never altered course, and never fell out of the sky - it just kept moving at a decent rate of speed, and seemed to be able to turn lights off and on.

the "craft" did not have wing lights, either - planes will have lights flashing on the wings, and helicopters will have a tail rotor flashing light - this had neither.  it was a bright red, pulsating "ball", moving very quickly from south to north - not darting back and forth, etc.  it was also completely silent.

weird!
content.summary: Good-sized pulsating red "orb" - moving at a good rate of speed.

content.detailedDescription:
Friday night about 11 pm i was around the block on my friend's deck, looking up at the stars.
at first there was nothing strange.
 i looked up at the stars again  and saw a white light that i could compare to a huge floodlight with no beam. it was moving very slowely, from south to north. lasted about 8 seconds.
at first i said is that a planet? but then said no that's too big. my friend missed it but saw my face and ran to get the binoculars but it was gone before he got back.
as soon as i said that,(no, that's too big) you could see a flash, something close over it, kinda like two sections closing and the thing took off. it looked like a shooting star went to the left (or south),after the light was blocked, and the object continued north, but mostly straight out and away from earth at a rate of speed that i could not compare to any jetfighter i've seen, fast!
it was definately not in the earth's hemisphere,when it left, and when the beam of light went out, it was now as tiny as a star with a one red and one white light.
the weird thing is that is definately moved toward outer space, not around the earth. i watched it move further out until it went through a mist in outer space. i was able to watch the two lights for about 10 seconds. then i could not see it anymore. it was so far out there.

i can make a sketch if you'd like.
thank you.
content.summary: Round white light about the size of a dime at arm's distance.

content.detailedDescription: I'll just get to it.. i have 20/20 vision.. no drinking tonight. it was early morning, and i couldn't sleep.. went outside to have a smoke.. just sitting there staring up at the sky, not totally paying attention and then a very dim twinkling star caught my attention, and it was wavey-looking as if i was witnessing it through a hot-air distortion, but then i discovered it was moving (or began to move), and then it got crisp and clear.. i thought at that point, ok, it's must be a satellite.. but it had another light following along very closely, and i thought i saw a shadow of under belly of a craft or something geometrical (if i had to pick i'd say triangular-ish looking shape).. and the second diagonally trailing light was dimmer slightly.. and more orange-ish in color.. i would have guessed this was very high up.. it was tiny looking.. i would never had seen it if i had not been gazing out at that exact spot where i first found it. the first light didn't have much color, but it wasn't stark white either.. just very dim.. and then i thought, ok, that's a big satellite probably. and in the process of watching it, it did a graceful but nice 25 degree arc to the west. then i sat straight up, practically fell out of my chair.. got up..  and lost sight of it. it was so dim folks.. it was originally cruising south-south west..  now it would be south-west and westerly in direction..  hope that helps anyone who might have seen something like this around these parts lately..  it was exciting to see that, and i have been watching the skies around here for a quite a while and haven't seen anything remotely like that.. it was the turn it made.. completely unpredictable..  birds don't catch reflections like that at night..  we do have fruit bats, but i know what those look like.. this was slow, not quick, and there was no noise.  i would say it was half the speed (or less) of anything else i have seen cruise around in the sky day or night.. almost a nice fluid like motion to it. i haven't seen anything like it before, that's for sure. looked controlled, and no winds tonight.. great viability.. lots of stars..  had a nice meteor sighting last night as well, was going to report it, but someone else did.. the meteor last night was located in this south.. it moved from the sse to ssw very quickly.. it must have been big and re-entered quickly.. brightest meteor i have seen in a long while too.  however like the other guy that reported it in gilbert, i didn't actually see the streak, i saw the shadows that it made across the yard.. it lit everything up like a magnesium flare.. anyways.. hope this helps..
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Thought it was a satellite but it changed directions and faded out.

content.detailedDescription: Myself and four of my friends were walking out to our cars when i looked up in the sky to the west and saw a very bright light moving. it had no flashing lights like an airplane would have an the light coming from it was too bright to be any aircraft that i know of. it was heading in a west to east direction. it had to be rather large judging from the size of the lighted area. we were able to see it all the way until it started to make a very sharp turn and then the light all the sudden went off. this was no meteor, no aircraft that any of us were familiar with, it made no noise at all. within seconds there was two other airplanes right in the area where this light had disappeared. this was definitely a craft of some sorts and to the other people that have reported this, yes we saw the exact same thing you saw so no you are not seeing things!!! i knew it was a ufo right when i saw it as there is nothing i know of that flys in the sky at night with lights as bright as these and especially without the flashing lights that are faa mandatory for all aircraft. it gave me the chills and every time i think about i still get the chills!!
content.summary: Bright light flying west to east

content.detailedDescription: This morning i witnessed a ufo. i went to my back door to let in my cats. i looked into the shy as day was dawning and saw a very bright object. it changed shape a couple of times. some moments it appeared as a cross, some moments it appeared as a disk with 2 light rays shooting from the top. there were occaisonal dimmer lights moving to and from the object. it also had 2 lines shooting out from the sides. the 2 bars of light from the top were red and blue and formed a v shape, the 2 on the sides were blue. it also would flash lights brighter than itself, and it was very bright. i got goose bumps when i realised it wasnt a star. and as it would change, i had fear mixed with excitement. as it stands it is still out there. dimmer, but still clearly visible. i just went out to look at the object again, it is gone now, but there are no less than 5 con trails in the air above my home. i also saw a very bright, glowing whit object flying at an incredible rate of speed over my home that left a contrail. it could have been a jet, but ive never seen a jet like it before. it was extremely bright. it looks as if i wasnt the only one that noticed(air force?) im going back out to look for further activity. it is now 5:41. 2 more jets over head one was easoly identifiable as a jet heading after the extremely bright object that left the contrail. something is happening here.
content.summary: Bright sparkling. changed shape. sometimes a cross. ha 2 light rays shooting out the top.

content.detailedDescription:
First, an observation made by my brother and his wife, six months ago. around midnight, above the hill behind their house. seven orange lights in a rough circle, presumed to be chinese fire lanterns. that is until, all converged to a central point. then went straight up and disappeared.
now my sighting on 10:15pm 23/5/09. weather: cloudless sky, numerous stars visible. no wind whatever detectable at ground level. confirmed by the bbc cfax forecast, as 2 mph sse. a possibility of frost overnight due to the stillness and cloudlessness. with the wind at 9:00am 24/5/09, anticipated to be nne at 4 mph.
went outside to place rubbish in the bin. turned, to see what i can best describe as a very bright but tremulous, ragged sheriff���s star of orange light. with the hint of a smaller red light somewhere within it. bearing 225 degrees at 50 degrees elevation. this light moved at a rapid and steady speed in a very slight arc toward a bearing of 65 degrees. while maintaining the existing angle of elevation relative to me. as it passed, at it���s nearest point to my position, the orange light faded (as i would expect the main white landing headlights on an aircraft to do).
while i stood there, a second light repeated the display. and within a few moments of that disappearing, a third light did the same. i obtained the interactive tv weather reports mentioned above. still curious, i returned outside at about 10:30pm, to see a pair of these lights pass over while perfectly maintaining a set separation line astern formation. i would assume that all these items were chinese fire lanterns/some type of aircraft, except for the following. if launched at the nearest non-visible point to me, at an absolute minimum, they would have had to travel a quarter of a mile (measured at ground level), in thirty seconds. that equates to a speed of 30 mph or more (depending on actual height). yet there was absolutely no evidence of any wind. their passing was silent, monitored in a period of perfect silence, with hands cupped behind the ears. although, interspersed with these two sets of events i did experience the standard illumination pattern of a couple of aircraft, passing in an almost opposite direction at a similar apparent speed. these were airliners cleared off the bovingdon stack into heathrow. on route to woodley vor, before turning left onto heathrow ils runway 09. these exhibited the usual distinctive distant rumbling roar, which lags behind them. if chinese fire lanterns, i would not have expected these other items to all fade in exactly the same spot, directly in front of me. but rather some to fade as they approached, with others fading some moments after they had passed. if launched close at hand, wouldn���t they have burnt for more that thirty seconds to a minute? in addition, and strangest of all. with the last two, and because i was staring more intently with hand-shielded eyes. i could still follow their trajectory after the orange light was obscured. they were visible as two feint pale blue/white star-like dots. apparently continuing at the same speed, height, and direction. if this was a reflection off some metal surface, it was not caused by the street lighting hereabouts. as this is orange sodium, and not white son.  furthermore, on going to the rear of the house, i saw what appeared to be one of these same dim ���star-lights��� travelling from se to nnw at 80 degrees elevation on a meandering path.
content.summary: Six lights.

content.detailedDescription: This event took place almost 30 years ago,but i still think of it often.I was coming home from church in greers ferry,with car full of neices and nephews,when i turned the corner to cross the dam ther in the middle was a cigar shaped silver object.It mad no noise and seamed to be just hovering.As i got on the dam it shot stright down onto the little red river side. i speed up to see where it had gone but it was gone.I can't think of anything that could go from still to that kind of speed.Kid's were verry frightened.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Ufo sighted over jfk. dam.

content.detailedDescription:
On march 13th ,i was on the 10t fl of the fallsview
casino hotel.My window faced the american falls.So 
with my camera at full 4x zoom i took some pics in 
the direction above goat island.When i got home and
uploaded the pics to my computer i found these 4 like
objects-saucer-like objects in one photo.The first is
the original photo,the i tried to bring out some high-
lights and added some warm filters to the photo.
i dont think this is some out of foucus bird or 
insect--notice the light reflect from the middle
of all the objects...
content.summary: Captured 4 ufo's like object's

content.detailedDescription:
I was leaving a friend's house at about 9:20 in the evening and we paused to take in the sky as it had been raining earlier and now the stars were shining.  as i looked with my friends ( a man and his wife) i was showing them the big dipper and noticed that there was a "star" that was twinkling.  i remarked that i thought that was odd, because none of the other visible stare were twinkling.

i told my friends i would take a look with my binoculars when i got home.  my house was a ten minute drive from their place and when i got home i got my binoculars out and took a quick look at this "star".  i was not able to resolve it into any shape, but it was red, green, and white and appeared  to oscillate between those colors.  at this point i knew it was not a star.  

i hurried into the house to get my telescope because the object was slowly drifting to the horizon.

my telescope is a questar 3.5 and i used a 16mm occular which provided 81 power magnification and about  a 1 arc second resolution.  i found the object and attempted to focus but was not able to image anything other than a point of light that varied between red, green and white.  

because of where i had my focus set, in relationship to other nearby stars, i had the impression that this object was really far away (outside the atmosphere).  the light was fairly bright for the distance.  i would guess a magnitude 3.  i watched the object for about 10 minutes before it went below the horizon.

this was not a plane, blimp, weather balloon or any conventional flying object.

i am a retired army officer with an extensive background in missiles and air defense.
content.summary: I saw what appeared to be a twinkling star about 45 degrees above the horizon at approximately nnw.

content.detailedDescription:
Any who read this should note that this ufo was, in all likelihood, just a streetlamp, whose beams of light were partially shaded by a tree. however, given certain unusual circumstances, i felt i should report it anyway.

while reading a book at home, i happened to look up and see three flashing white lights in a triangular arrangement outside my window. they lasted for about 20 seconds, and then suddenly dissappeared. there was no movement, but the lights were flashing in and out, changing in brightness. 

the instant i had seen the ufo, i experienced a sudden feeling of terror; however, this was probably because earlier that day, i had read a book written by a man named ted owens, who had claimed that he had communicated with space intelligences (sis) and had "charged" the book so that the sis would have contact with all who read it.

i am not sure what the ufo was, or whether it had anything to do with the reading of that book. i am highly skeptical as to whether it has anything to do with that. i ran over to my computer immediately, after the lights had faded away from the window.
content.summary: Three flashing lights in a triangle.

content.detailedDescription: While sitting outside with girlfriend we noticed what seemed like a lightning flash. there was only a few very small clouds almost a 100% clear night. i did not see where the flash came from and i thought it came from the south. my girlfriend did see it and said it was from the north but whatever it was it was very bright. it started out as a pulsing flash like lightning off in the distance. it pulsed and then ended with one very bright flash. i stood up and looked behind me to see if there was any vapor trail from a possible meteor entry but there was nothing. my girlfriend also said it left no trail... just disappeared. i waited to hear if there was any sound but no rumble was heard. i checked the weather radar and it there was nothing around for a hundred miles.
content.summary: Two or three flashes followed by one larger flash.

content.detailedDescription:
My husband and i were sitting outside enjoying the warmth of a fire we had made in our fire pit and gazing up at the stars.  the night was quite cool and crisp, but the sky was very clear with many stars.  as we were looking up, we noticed a fairly bright object making its way across the sky in an arc-type path.

the object moved steadily and consistently in a soft arc from the northwestern part of the sky to the southeastern part of the sky.  it did not move exceptionally fast, but moved at a quicker pace than that of most planes we see.  we assumed it was a plane, but continued to watch it as we could not see any blinking lights and it was extremely bright for the planes we normally see.  i did not take my eyes off of the object because i was sure i would see blinking lights at any moment.  as we both watched it move across the sky, the object appeared to get brighter and brighter - almost growing in size.  the light that was coming from the object was similar to the very bright white light you see coming from the solor-powered lights that people often put around their gardens.  i kept watching the object and convinced myself that i would see blinking lights at any moment, but there were none.  as we watched the object, it continued to get brighter and brighter and then suddenly, it dimmed and completely disappeared.  i double-checked to see if it could have suddenly gone behind some clouds, but there were absolutely no clouds in the sky.  there were stars all around the area where it disappeared, so we know that there were no clouds present.

when i realized that i had seen something that we could not explain, i was excited, yet my mind still tried to rationalize and create some logical explanation for what the object was.  i knew the object was unusual when it went from emitting extremely bright light to dimming and disappearing in a matter of approximately 4-5 seconds.  i would be very curious to know if others have seen something similar.
content.summary: Extremely bright star-like object which traveled across the sky.

content.detailedDescription: On sunday 05/24/09 at approximately 11:20 pm i observed a bright white light traveling almost directly overhead of my location. at first i believed the object to be the international space station. i had stated to the others in my party what i thought the object was. just as i had just stated this the object disappeared. i believed it gained altitude at an extreme rate and vanished. one of the other witnesses stated it was probably a shooting star. the other stated it looked as if it just burned out or dimmed. although we could not agree what happened to the object we all agreed that it was indeed unusual. i have seen the iss pass over at least three times in the past two years as our local weatherman advises when it can be seen. i just wish i could have taken a pic or video.
content.summary: Bright light that dimmed or disappeared as it gained altitude.

content.detailedDescription: My wife, daughters and i were camping in gifford pinchot national forest sunday, may 24th. we went for a walk about 9:45-10 p.M. that evening. on the way back to our campsite through the camping area, i happened to look up through the trees and saw a very bright object moving quickly across the sky. i pointed it out to my wife and daughters, and we agreed that it was extremely bright, moving fast, and had no other aircraft navigational lights on it. there was no jet sound, either - even well after it passed from view beyond the steep ridge surrounding our camping area. i had not checked a compass earlier that day so i can't be certain as to its direction but it seemed to be moving from west-northwest to east-southeast. the thing that stands out the most was that it was very, very bright - probably two to three times as bright as the brightest star in the night sky.
content.summary: Very bright star-like object traversed sky rapidly

content.detailedDescription: Bill,there is a clear pic of a triangler shaped object on google maps satilite mode at -30.51079,115.382311  lets see what lie our goverment can come up with now!
content.summary: Google maps in satellite mode -30.51079,115.382311.

content.detailedDescription: I took a pic of one there has been as many as three in the same areas
content.summary: I call them patrollers because they patrol our skies.

content.detailedDescription: My father came in from outside to tell me that he saw an object in the sky. i walked outside and barely made out a small white speck high in the sky. after several seconds i was able to make out another object next to the first, then a third. the object looked only like a small white speck so i decided to get out my reflecting telescope to get a better look. once i found the objects again i focused my telescope on the objects. they appeared to be perfect spheres with a pearl-like quality but were very reflective as i could see the reflection of the sun perfectly on the object. they did not appear to be balloons as they were a perfect sphere with no tip and no shape similar to that of a balloon. also they were stationary above the small town in which we live. as for size, i witnessed a passenger airliner pass between me and the objects, the diameter was the length of the wings but the object could be larger as it was behind the airliner and it could of been much further behind and above. after thirty minutes or so they began to slowly break from their loose formation and began to very slowly drift apart until i simply couldn't look through the telescope due to the bright sky and my eyes. they are still there as far as i know.
content.summary: Three shiny pearl-like spheres at high altitude.

content.detailedDescription: Hovered over hwy 69 in beaumont then split possibly then there were two visible for a few minutes . many sightings recently
content.summary: Mercury like plasma flashed bright once seemed brighter than the sun.

content.detailedDescription: At about 10:30 p.M. us and our two friends were outside smoking and looking up at the stars, when my husband seen this bright light, thinking it was a sattelite.��� so we all looked up and realized it was moving to quick to be a sattelite.��� it was very low, lower than a high flying aircraft.��� it had no blinking lights, like an airplane or helicopter, and it was completely quiet.��� we continued to watch it go off to the east and all of a sudden it was just gone, like someone turned the light off. me and my girlfriend didn't know what to think, and my husband and her boyfriend couldn't quit staring at the sky, waiting for it to come back.��� we didn't know what we just saw, but we thought it was crazy.
content.summary: Bright light moving west to east with no sound.

content.detailedDescription: Taking a picture of stadium in arlington. loaded pic onto my pc at home, uploaded to my website http://www.Cox2020.Net . didn't enlarge the pic until this morning may 25,2009  and noticed the dot to the left side of stadium above small cloud. blew it up to 800% in picasa and it sure doesn't look like a plane or a bird. not sure what it is.
content.summary: Taking pic of the new dallas stadium in arlington, didn't know i captured this object in the background.

content.detailedDescription:
On 5-25-2009 around 9:45 pm, we were watching tv, our son had taken the dog outside, and came back in the house quickly to tell us to come outside as there is a lighted object in the sky, my wife, my daughter (age 13), my son (age 17), and myself
went out and observed a bright object in the sky about south west of us and watched it come north to above us, then i grabbed my blackberry cell phone and took a video of it, when i started taken the video it was slowy moving away from us to the south east, it got smaller then disapeared.
it was way lower than the stars and ther was no noise, it was quite...
the sky was clear and stars were out.
this object was bright and looked like to have a tint of blue when it started going south east...
the video appears to have deformed the object shape as it appeared to be round....
the object was very steady when moving but slow, then as heading south east it still was steady moving but got faster and smaller till it was gone...In the video it is the larger lighted object.....
i also extracted 2 pictures from the video clip...
content.summary: Lighted object in sky above our home..
